channel.title: How are your social lives?
channel.description:
First of all, I don't want this to be made out as me having a pity party, I'm really just curious as you how your lives are and I want to start by describing mine.
For years now I have struggled with a lot of social problems. I have severe problems with social anxiety and quelling that anxiety, I've also slumped into depression numerous times back when I didn't really have many creative outlets; I've found a lack of that creativity tends to eat at your self esteem.
Anyhow, a big part of my life I've felt like there aren't a lot of people I can relate to in my real life, I've very rarely experienced a connection with someone face to face whereas I feel there's something special there. I get easily pissed off or uncomfortable with people, and it's a huge barrier for me. To put it bluntly, I'm your stereotypical computer nerd who pretty much lives his life a shut-in.
Anyways, I still am happy with my life. We've all got our bullshit we have to deal with. What's yours? Do you have problems with people socially where you feel as if you hate everyone/don't really fit in? Just curious because well, we all certainly share a unique interest, and I've always wondered if this stereotype is true across the board or if it's just me.

item.title: How are your social lives?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:34, topic:542828”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=661704.msg4423090#msg4423090 date=1399383010]

I’m not getting any sex which sucks

That sucks man. But I mean to be honest, I love hooking up with random people, but it’s better if its someone you trust. Go for finding a girlfriend. Someone whos pretty goofy, introverted, kind. Australia has a lot of nice looking babes and I bet one of them would love to date the great dongatello
[/quote]
Someone said they wanted to meet me on Plenty of Fish yesterday. I got excited until I visited the profile and saw that she was about 40kg overweight.
It goes without saying that I won’t be messaging her.[/quote]
Oh you poor men with your standards.

Every girl is beautiful, and has something of value - this girl’s obviously is what I like to consider practice. Practice your game with her, try stuff you don’t know will work with other girls, etc.

Let me guess, you’re the kind of guy who goes through a girls photos before swiping right on tinder?

Read full topic

item.title: How are your social lives?
item.dc:creator: @Bended Bended
item.description:
@Bended wrote:

Not too good I’ve gone into a type of depression where it’s hard for me to even get up and go to school. I give up fairly quickly on things (I’ve never been like that) and just stopped caring, being scared, and just said fuck it to everything, which got me into juvenile detention… But I’m getting better now starting to talk to more people, getting out of depression, and just taking my mind off it with skate boarding and getting high occasionally with friends. Also I used to have high social anxiety you should get over it soon if you just say fuck what people think and get some confidence. I know that’s some blunt and kind of weird advice but it works.

Read full topic

item.title: How are your social lives?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I haven’t had much of a social life recently.

I go out to work, and then I sit around all day at the house with the lady. It’s nice, really, I haven’t really cared to go out to party, or have a night-out recently. The peacefulness is relaxing and just getting high with the girlfriend eases all the stress. So I’d say my social life is pretty good, just not active.

Read full topic

item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

In all honesty my social life is pretty good, my actually personal life is pretty bad lately but I go to work and enjoy good conversations when on lunch with coworkers we laugh amd relax. A group of us got together and hung out played some Mario party 3 on my N64. Felt like a kid again just with worse language
